intro: Paragynoxys venezuelae, commonly known as the Venezuelan paragynoxys, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
